intro: Molinaea tolambitou var. obtusa, commonly known as the Tolambitou molinaea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
